topic.title: Daily Standup
topic.p: A Daily Standup is a short daily meeting where teams can share status and get help with any impediments to getting their job done. Everyone takes a turn talking about 1) What they did yesterday 2) What they'll work on today and 3) Anything that's blocking them from getting their work done. Long discussions are taken off-line and the meeting doesn't last more than a few minutes.
If your team participates in a daily standup, it's nice to have your story wall displayed nearby. Why?

bullets.item: It can jog your team's memory on what they worked on
It helps identify possible bottlenecks and impediments (which can help the team prioritize their day)
Make sure it is viewable by everyone participating in your standup
Change your card view (group by, sort by, color by, grid versus list versus hierarchy) based on your daily or weekly objective
To jog your memory before standup, take a look at your Mingle project's History tab and filter to show changes made by you in the last 24 hours.
